stk.calculators.energy package¶

Module contents¶

Defines energy calculators.

Energy calculators are objects which calculate the energy of molecules. Each EnergyCalculator is initialized with some settings and calculates the energy of a molecule with energy().

# Energy calculators work with any Molecule objects, such as
# StructUnit, Polymer, Cage, etc.
mol1 = StructUnit(...)
mol2 = Cage(...)
mol3 = Polymer(...)

# Create the energy calculator.
mmff = MMFFEnergy()

# Calculate energies of various molecules.
mol1_energy = mmff.energy(mol1)
# We can optionally specify a conformer.
mol2_energy = mmff.energy(mol2, conformer=1)
mol3_energy = mmff.energy(mol3)

By default, calling energy() twice on the same molecule will calculate the energy a second time. However, we can use the use_cache option to prevent recalculations when the same molecule and conformer are given to the same energy calculator a second time.

caching_mmff = MMFFEnergy(use_cache=True)
# Calculate the energy the first time.
energy1 = caching_mmff.energy(mol1)
# The second time, the energy is returned directly from memory, a
# second calculation is not run.
energy2 = caching_mmff.energy(mol1)

Available energy calculators.¶

  1. MMFFEnergy
  2. UFFEnergy
  3. MacroModelEnergy
  4. MOPACEnergy
  5. FormationEnergy
  6. XTBEnergy
  7. XTBFreeEnergy

Extending stk: Making new energy calculators.¶

New energy calculators can be made by simply making a class which inherits the EnergyCalculator class. In addition to this, the new class must define a energy() method. The method must take 2 arguments, a mandatory mol argument and an optional conformer argument. The method will then calculate and return the energy. There are no requirements regarding how it should go about calculating the energy. New energy calculators can be added into the energy_calculators submodule or into a new submodule.
